lines.text:
[reaches for his ears]
My God! The place really is haunted; what is that?
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text: Well, without looking, I would say with confidence it must be Carlotta.
Who?
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text: The new star.
She can't sing!
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text:
[chuckles]
Well, obviously she doesn't know that.
Well, someone should tell her.
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text: She's married to the new manager.
Good God. This means she's probably going to sing all the time. What kind of horror are you leaving me in?
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text: Erik, what are we going to do about all of this?
I know what to do about it. I'll kill them both.
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text: Oh, come on, now!
I'm teasing; probably the only one I need to kill is her.
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text: Erik!
What has happened to your sense of humour?
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text: My humour?
You're right. I'm sorry. I'm just not used to killing people; it threw me off a bit.
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text:
[about Christine]
Now, listen to me. For as long as I can remember, ever since I was a child, I have dreamed of her. Now, people are born for many things, Gerard. I was born to live, if one can call this living, down here. But until now, I have never known quite why. I was born so that she could save me, for that's what she's done. She is the reason I was born! I love her, Gerard! And I believe in time, with any luck, she will learn to love me. It would be a cruel God indeed to have sent her otherwise.
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text: I don't believe in ghosts!
[a marble bust falls behind him]
Aaaa!

[speaking of Christine]
She has natural talent.
Talent like that is not natural. Someone has been teaching her!
What?
No-one can sing bel canto without lessons. God doesn't allow it.
I'd thought about being buried in my lagoon. Then I thought, no, float up and scare some poor child downstream.
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text: Did you know my mother well?
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text:
[pause, then]
Yes.
Did you love her?
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text:
[long pause, then]
Yes, I loved her.
And she let you see my face.
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text: She thought your face was absolutely and flawlessly beautiful.
What did you think of it?
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text: Well I - I thought it could have been better.
[pauses, then]
I'm your father.

[nods knowingly]
I wondered when you'd say.
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text:
[Gerard looks stunned; Erik continues]
You see, my eyes are the only part of my face I can look at in a mirror without wishing to break the glass. But they're not her eyes. They're yours.
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text: Father?
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text: Yes?
I'm sorry for what I've put you through.
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text: Well, actually, there never was a day I'd have given any of it up for anything.
Oh, I like that story. Tell me another fairy tale.
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text: It's true.
Why?
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text: Because you have your mother's soul.
Let me see your face.
You have asked, I'm afraid, the only thing in my power that I cannot grant. Please don't ask it again.
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text: Let her go! I beg you, please, let her go!
She sang for me tonight; she's mine!
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text: Erik has been more than a son to me. My friend and my guide. For the last thirty years, the truth is he has been the real director of this opera house, not I. If we were a great company - and we were - it was because of him. Every decision on repertoire, to the smallest prop, was his. My own small talent, such as it was, was keeping him alive. And now I must leave. And he cannot. But you can, and you must, for your own sake as well as his. If you love him as you say you do, please, don't give him any false hope. You will crush him utterly, and in the process, you will destroy yourself.
All in all, not all that bad - being born I mean. Because I could hear music, and I heard Christine.
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text: She didn't mean to hurt you.
I know that. She just asked for too much of me, that's all. Not her fault - thought she loved me.
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text: She does.
She did. But only for a moment. Still, a moment such as that is worth living for, wouldn't you say? I do regret one thing, though.
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text: What's that?
Not having killed the Comte de Chagny.
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text: But why?
Because he doesn't love music, so how can he possibly love her?
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text: He loves her.
If you say so.
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text: She was just unprepared for you.
She was unprepared for ugliness. And for that brief, sweet moment, so was I.
lines.character: Erik The Phantom of the Opera

lines.text:
[speaking of Erik]
I'm not afraid. Now I know his heart.
So do I. Unfortunately, there is more to him than that.
You said my voice reminded you of a certain singer.
That's right. Unfortunately, it's reminded someone else of her as well.

[to Count Philippe de Chagny]
Believe me, my dear friend. Her love for him is a far different thing than her love for you. If you turn away from her now, she'll die.
But how can you be sure that he'll hear you from down there?
There are areas down there where one can hear the stage perfectly.He'll know what I'm singing for him and he'll know what that means.
That you love him?
Yes. But it's not the same kind of love I have for you. It's not the same at all.
[Christine puts her hand on Philippe's cheek and kisses him. Philippe then kisses Christine]
